posts.post_content: As soon as this was spoiled, I made a proxy deck with [Clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone), [Stolen Identity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stolen Identity), etc. I discovered that adding another creature that likes to be copied, such as [Timberpack Wolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Timberpack Wolf), gives the deck another win condition and makes it more consistent.
posts.html:

Posted By: Buderus (3/2/2013 9:07:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A fun little build-around card. As a bonus, the you-win triggers on the end step, and not the upkeep, meaning that sorcery speed shenanigans (Rite of Replication, I'm looking at you) can win you the game that turn. Tapping out against a Biovisionary player with 8+ mana available is just asking for trouble.  
  
Vorinclex works well in this sort of deck, as it makes the opponent more prone to tapping out, while providing you a significant mana boost - which can be very handy if you want to cast a kicked Rite or Rep with countermagic backup.  
  
Beyond that, there are a lot of awesome creatures in blue and green that like being cloned. Eternal Witness, of course, lets you use copy spells like Rite and Cackling Counterpart for free, giving you a 2/1 for 3 or 4 mana and no card loss. Mystic Snake just loves Cackling Counterpart. You can never get enough Frost and Primeval Titans. And worst case scenario, Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch turn copy spells into more ramp.  
  
Finally, Fauna Shaman ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
A fun little build-around card. As a bonus, the you-win triggers on the end step, and not the upkeep, meaning that sorcery speed shenanigans (Rite of Replication, I'm looking at you) can win you the game that turn. Tapping out against a Biovisionary player with 8+ mana available is just asking for trouble.

Vorinclex works well in this sort of deck, as it makes the opponent more prone to tapping out, while providing you a significant mana boost - which can be very handy if you want to cast a kicked Rite or Rep with countermagic backup.

Beyond that, there are a lot of awesome creatures in blue and green that like being cloned. Eternal Witness, of course, lets you use copy spells like Rite and Cackling Counterpart for free, giving you a 2/1 for 3 or 4 mana and no card loss. Mystic Snake just loves Cackling Counterpart. You can never get enough Frost and Primeval Titans. And worst case scenario, Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch turn copy spells into more ramp.
